learning_outcomes.description: Understand the basic concepts in international commercial arbitration.
Understand the laws and legal instruments that may be applicable to an international commercial arbitration.
Draft an appropriate form of international arbitration agreement/clause.
Understand the relationship between litigation and an agreement to arbitrate, and the legal issues raised when enforcing an agreement to arbitrate.
Understand the implications of the selection of an arbitral institution, seat/venue, and choice of laws issues.
Understand generally how to commence and conduct an international commercial arbitration;
Understand generally how to conduct a hearing in an international arbitration;
Understand the legal rights that the parties (for enforcement and challenge) in relation to an arbitral award.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be required to prepare a case note that describes and analyses a significant decision dealing with international commercial arbitration. Students will be provided with a list of cases to choose from on the first day of the course.


The word limit for the essay is a maximum of 2,500 words any material beyond that will not be read, and penalties will be applied of 1 mark per 100 words over the word limit. By way of clarification, this 2,500 words:

  • includes headings;
  • does not include text in the header or word count; and
  • does not include footnotes - however footnotes should be used for citation purposes only. Any substantive text that appears in the footnote will not be read and will not contribute to your mark.

For style and referencing, students should refer to the Australian Guide to Legal Citation. See item 3.4 of this course profile for further details.


This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment must be submitted electronically via the assessment submission link on the course Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Individual work

The Exam must be the individual student’s own work and the following conditions apply:

  • Students are not to consult with any other person in relation to the questions on the assessment. Students may consult with the Course Coordinator if clarification of any question is thought necessary. The Course Coordinator may circulate clarifications to the entire class if necessary or appropriate.
  • Students are required to sign a declaration that the answers submitted are their own, and that they have not consulted with any other person in relation to the assessment. Answers submitted without this declaration will not be accepted.
  • Where it is established that a student has consulted with any other person in relation to the questions on the assessment, that student shall be awarded a mark of ‘0’ even if the student’s answers would otherwise meet the criteria for any higher mark.


Format and Length

The assessment answers should include all of the following on the title page:

  • The student’s name and number;
  • A declaration that the answers are the student’s own work and that he or she has not consulted with any other person (This is very important); and
  • The word count.


The Exam will be a mixture of short answer questions, essay questions and problem questions. Details of the word limit will be provided on the assessment paper; penalties will be applied for assessment papers that go over the word limit, with information provided on the assessment paper.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
